instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> solved thank you
threads.message: hi friends I just want to thank you because today I solve all by myself a board with a issue on the one wire circuit , one of the paths on <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> was corroded I just run a jumper wire to L6995 and that was it , machine works with no backlight , fuse was bad  I replace it and done. :)

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> solved thank you
[solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> solved thank you
threads.message: That is a very long wire for this purpose,but good work all the same! It is called onewire, not oneshortwire, so you're good. :)
